intro: Bupleurum balansae f. mauritanicum, commonly known as the Mauritanian cicely, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to North Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that bloom in umbels. It typically grows in dry, rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. This subspecies is of interest for its potential medicinal properties and ecological role in its native habitat.
